[[File:Dmitry Prosvirnin - Neekerbreekers.jpg|thumb|''“Neekerbreekers”'' by Dmitry Prosvirnin]]
'''Neekerbreekers''' were abominable and evil insects dwelling in the [[reeds]] and tussocks of the [[Midgewater Marshes]].<ref name=history>{{FR|I11}}</ref>

==History==
The origin of these creatures is unknown, though they "were evil relatives of the cricket" because of their sound. On [[2 October]] in {{TA|3018}}, [[Aragorn|Strider]] led the [[Hobbits]] to [[Weathertop]]. While in the [[Midgewater Marshes]], the group decided to make camp, though as night fell, most of the group found themselves unable to sleep as a consequence of reportedly hearing thousands of "Neekerbreekers", as Sam called them.<ref name=history/>

==Etymology==
"Neekerbreeker" was an "insect-name" that was named so because of their sound, perhaps "like that of a cricket".<ref name="Nomen">{{HM|N}}, p. 760</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In an early draft of the chapter "[[A Knife in the Dark]]", the creatures known as Neekerbreekers were unnamed and described as being "over-grown cousins of the cricket" because the sound they made was "shriller… and even more persistent" than a cricket.<ref name=nature>{{RS|1IX}}, p. 166</ref>

==Inspiration==
It may be possible that these creatures were related to the Gryllidae cricket family.<ref name=name>{{webcite|author=Mark Fisher|articleurl=https://www.glyphweb.com/arda/n/neekerbreekers.html|articlename=Neekerbreekers|dated=11 April 2021|website=EoA|accessed=8 December 2024}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
:In the [[1994]] ''Creatures of Middle-earth: A Bestiary of Animals and Monsters'' supplement, Neekerbreekers are "relatives of the mosquito" instead of the cricket and are described as solid meat carnivores that are 1-2 inches tall. Waybread and foul swamps attracts them. An illness called Yellow Rheum can be contracted by Neekerbreekers through bites.<ref name=merp>''Creatures of Middle-earth: A Bestiary of Animals and Monsters'' (2nd edition), pp. 17-20</ref>

'''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game]]'':'''
: In a card set called ''The Nîn-in-Eilph'', "Neekerbreekers" is the name of an enemy card that can cause a player to deal two damage to a controlled ally if used.<ref>''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game]]'', ''The Nîn-in-Eilph''</ref>

'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
: [https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Neekerbreekers Neekerbreekers] appear in many locations throughout ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''. While most appear hostile, one Neekerbreeker named [https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Sniken Sniken] was taken as a pet by a [[Bree-landers|Bree-lander]] named [https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Roderick_Neeker-friend Roderik Neeker-friend]. Roderick [https://lotro-wiki.com/wiki/Quest:Neeker-friend tasks] the player character with hunting sickle-fly wings to provide food for Sniken. When Roderick tries feeding the wings to Snicken, his hands are nearly purposefully bitten off.
